column4: Hi guys, trying to setup ip masquerading on my unbuntu 9.10, but running into all sorts of iptables problems, probably the service isn't even running and chkconfig and service aren't even able to identify the service.
Any clue?
Or if someone could tell me an easeir way to convert my ubuntu machine into a wifi hotspot :)
there is no iptables service
then how am I supposed to setup ip masquerading on ubuntu? Or do you mean I have to setup the iptables service first?
usually you create a script that sets up the rules
rules for what? If iptables doesn't even exist on the system?
it is built in to the kernel, so it is just there, waiting for you to do stuff
any idea how to start the service?
by default ubuntu has no listening services, so there are no rules defined
it is not a service
aah, then...?
there is nothing to start
the tutorials I am reading on net describe it so
sudo iptables -L will tell you what rules are defined, there should not be any
yea, there aren't
just start defining things from the command line
Aha,  There is no need for starting/restarting the service? How do I save those rules?
coz I did define some rules, and seems like system restart has flushed them out
aah, wish you could be here for a while
yes, you need to put them in a script which is where they will be remmeberd
okie
